Petani Tembakau Tuntut Kenaikan Cukai Rokok Hanya 15%
04 Nov 2019, 23:03 by Vadhia Lidyana


Foto: Demo Petani Tembakau di Depan Kementerian Keuangan, (Vadhia Lidyana/detikFinance)

Jakarta - Asosiasi Petani Tembakau Indonesia (APTI) Jawa Barat (Jabar) kemarin, Senin (4/11/2019) menggelar unjuk rasa di depan kantor Kementerian Keuangan. Dalam aksi tersebut, APTI Jabar juga menyampaikan keberatannya mengenai kenaikan cukai rokok rata-rata 23%, dan harga jual eceran (HJE) rata-rata 35% yang diatur dalam Peraturan Menteri Keuangan (PMK) nomor 152 tahun 2019.Selain memprotes kenaikan cukai rokok, APTI Jabar juga mengajukan keberatan mengenai Dana Bagi Hasil (DBH) Cukai Hasil Tembakau (CHT) yang diatur dalam PMK nomor 222 tahun 2017.APTI Jabar juga menyampaikan aspirasinya terkait volume impor tembakau di industri. APTI meminta agar pemerintah membatasi impor tembakau agar tembakau petani dalam negeri bisa terserap lebih banyak dan harga tak anjlok.Petani Minta Kenaikan Cukai Rokok Hanya 15%Pengurus DPC APTI Jabar, Didi Rohmana mengatakan, pihaknya meminta agar pemerintah mempertimbangkan kembali kenaikan cukai rokok. Menurutnya, yang ideal kenaikannya sebesar 10-15%."Yang pertama memperhatikan kenaikan cukai, ini perlu dipertimbangkan, jangan terlalu tinggi sampai 23%. Kami minta 10-15%. Kata Pak Dirjen itu di dalam proses pembahasan di tingkat menteri," ujar Pengurus DPC APTI Jabar, Didi Rohmana kepada detikcom di kantor Kemenkeu, Jakarta, Senin (4/11/2019).Menjawab hal tersebut, Direktur Jenderal Bea dan Cukai Kemenkeu Heru Pambudi mengatakan, pada penerapannya kenaikan cukai rokok bervariasi. Misalnya, kenaikan cukai rokok untuk jenis Sigaret Kretek Tangan (SKT) dimulai dari 12%. Kebijakan tersebut dilakukan untuk memperhatikan nasib tenaga kerja dan petani di industri padat karya tersebut."Kalau kita perhatikan PMK 152 itu meskipun average-nya adalah 23% dan 35%, tapi kalau kita lihat detailnya itu variatif. Pemerintah betul-betul telah memperhatikan kemampuan antar golongan, kemampuan antar jenis rokok. Sehingga kenaikan cukai rokok jenis SKT start-nya dari 12%. Itu membuktikan bahwa pemerintah memperhatikan tenaga kerja yang di industri padat karya, makanya kenaikan tarif SKT itu terendah. Ini berbeda dengan yang mesin, yang relatuif lebih tinggi," papar Heru. Menurutnya, kenaikan cukai rokok memang difokuskan untuk mengendalikan konsumsi dan produksi rokok. Namun, pemerintah tetap memperhatikan nasib industri dan tenaga kerja.Lanjut ke halaman berikutnya >>> (ang/ang)

Tobacco Farmers Demand Cigarette Excise Increase Only 15%
04 Nov 2019, 23:03 by Vadhia Lidyana


Photo: Tobacco Farmers Demo in Front of the Ministry of Finance, (Vadhia Lidyana / detikFinance)

Jakarta - Indonesian Tobacco Farmers Association (APTI) West Java (West Java) yesterday, Monday (11/04/2019) held a rally in front of the Ministry of Finance's office. In the action, APTI Jabar also raised its objections regarding an increase in cigarette excise averaging 23%, and an average retail selling price (HJE) of 35% as stipulated in Minister of Finance Regulation (PMK) number 152 2019. , APTI West Java also filed an objection regarding the Revenue Sharing Fund (DBH) of Tobacco Excise (CHT) regulated in PMK number 222 of 2017.APTI West Java also expressed its aspirations regarding the volume of tobacco imports in the industry. APTI requests that the government restrict tobacco imports so that domestic farmers' tobacco can be absorbed more and prices do not plummet. Peasants Ask for an Increase in Cigarette Excise Only 15% According to him, the ideal increase is 10-15%. "The first to pay attention to the increase in excise duty, this needs to be considered, not too high to 23%. We ask for 10-15%. The Director General said in the discussion process at the ministerial level," said West Java APTI DPC executive Didi Rohmana told AFP at the Ministry of Finance office, Jakarta, Monday (11/04/2019). Answering this, the Director General of Customs and Excise of the Ministry of Finance Heru Pambudi said, the implementation of cigarette excise tax increases varied. For example, the increase in cigarette excise for Hand Clove Cigarettes (SKT) starts at 12%. The policy is carried out to pay attention to the fate of workers and farmers in the labor-intensive industry. "If we look at PMK 152 even though the average is 23% and 35%, but if we look at the details it is varied. The government has really paid attention to the inter class, ability between types of cigarettes, so that the excise tax increase for SKT-type cigarettes starts from 12%, which proves that the government pays attention to workers in labor-intensive industries, so the increase in SKT rates is the lowest, this is different from machines, which are relatively higher. , "said Heru. According to him, the increase in cigarette excise tax was indeed focused on controlling cigarette consumption and production.
